response:
in accordance with article 13 of the general data protection regulation (gdpr) and the federal data protection act (bundesdatenschutzgesetz, bdsg), as a user, you have various rights that i can explain to you. 

firstly, according to article 15 gdpr and section 34 bdsg, you have the right to access personal data about yourself that is being processed. you can also request information about where this data came from and who it was shared with.

secondly, under article 16 gdpr and section 35 bdsg, you have the right to rectify your personal data if it is incorrect or incomplete. 

thirdly, under article 17 gdpr and section 36 bdsg, you have the right to erasure of your personal data if there are no legal retention requirements. however, this right only applies in certain circumstances, for example, if you withdraw your consent or when your personal data has been unlawfully processed.

finally, under article 18 gdpr and section 37 bdsg, you have the right to restrict processing of your personal data if it is incorrect or if you object to its processing. 

to exercise these rights, you can contact the controller directly via twitter's privacy policy page. you also have the option to complain to a supervisory authority under article 77 gdpr and section 19 bdsg.<|endoftext|>
